Question: Should patients with RA on two or more DMARDs who are at target for six months and longer withdraw DMARDs or continue DMARDs?

Explanations.a: Concern about the lack of blinding of participants and providers
Explanations.b: Pooled results reported as HR and RR in the 2 respective studies
Explanations.c: All included studies are at risk of bias
Explanations.e: CI includes both values suggesting harms and values suggesting no effect

References.1: Fautrel B, Pham T, Alfaiate T, Gandjbakhch F, Foltz V, Morel J, et al. Step-down strategy of spacing TNF-blocker injections for established rheumatoid arthritis in remission: Results of the multicentre non-inferiority randomised open-label controlled trial (STRASS: Spacing of TNF-blocker injections in Rheumatoid ArthritiS Study). Annals of the Rheumatic Diseases. 2016;75(1):59.
References.2: van Vollenhoven RF. Full dose, reduced dose or discontinuation of etanercept in rheumatoid arthritis. Ann Rheum Dis BMJ. 2016;75:52-8.
References.3: Moghadam MG. Stopping Tumor Necrosis Factor Inhibitor Treatment in Patients With Established Rheumatoid Arthritis in Remission or With Stable Low Disease Activity. ARTHRITIS & RHEUMATOLOGY. 2016;68(8):1810-7.
